TopicTitle: How to shift a part in a save file

Articles.Content:
In the course of building a mothership over Kerbin, I experienced a strange glitch where a part has shifted away from its original location.  You can see in the attached picture that all of the "pivotrons" from the infernal robotics mod are slightly off center (if your unfamiliar with the mod then its the 3 white cube things in the foreground of the picture).  This issue occured in 7 locations on the ship and I would like to edit the save file to return them back to their original location.  <--that is the point of this post... extra info that may or may not be helpful is below the picture.  

I looked up the .craft file for the original ship and compared it to the ship in the save file.  I had hoped that I could simply copy that section over into the save file to fix it... but the numbers for part positions look very different.  I am assuming that this is because the ship is docked at a shipyard and therefore does not have the same root as in the .craft file.  Or I simply dont understand how to read these files haha.

I have been working on this ship piece by piece in my free time for more than a month and there was a significant amount of difficult docking operations that I had to complete to bring together what I already have... So I am really hoping to avoid having to deorbit what I have already built and then hyper edit a replacement back up (this feels like a disheartening solution to me... even if it does turn out to be the simplest).

Can anyone point me in the right direction for figuring out how I can make this kind of save file edit?

Edit: KSP version 1.05

Edited April 27, 2016 by Uberns
added KSP version #
